names.pinyin: zhi shi zhi zi chi tang
names.english: bitter orange, gardenia and prepared soybean decoction
names.commonEnglish: Bitter Orange, Gardenia and Prepared Soybean Decoction

actions: Breaks up Stagnant Qi, reduces accumulation, descends Qi, unblocks the bowels and removes Stagnant Food.
With Zhi Zi, for a stifling sensation and distention in the epigastrium with feverishness after a febrile disease.
With Zhi Zi and Dan Dou Chi, for feelings of Heat in the body.
Clears Heat, reduces Fire and eliminates irritability.
With Dan Dou Chi, for Insomnia and irritability from Deficiency due to Heat lingering in the chest.
Releases the Exterior, eliminates irritability, harmonizes the Middle Jiao and relieves stuffy sensations in the chest.
With Zhi Zi, for Late-stage residual Heat trapped in the chest and diaphragm

syndromes: Qi Stage Heat lingering (in the chest, in particular), with Food Stagnation due to improper diet during convalescence.

manifestations.pulse: Floating, slippery and rapid especially on the right position or Floating, full and rapid
